main event: On 16 September 1957, in Pecos, New Mexico, a civilian observer reported seeing a disc-shaped object the size of a grapefruit, with a white color and yellow tint, leaving a very long dull blue vapor trail before disappearing instantly with no sound. The observation lasted for around one second as the object moved southwest and disappeared behind trees.
interesting points: The disc-shaped object was described as the size of a grapefruit with a white color and yellow tint, leaving a very long dull blue vapor trail before disappearing instantly with no sound.
The observation lasted for only around one second, indicating the briefness of the event.
The object's flight path and disappearance behind trees suggest its movement and trajectory.
The observer used eyeglasses for the ground-visual observation.
The observer reported clear and cool weather conditions with no wind and a clear sky at the time of the sighting.
